website_summaries.verdict: A superior wide-angle lens that works well in most settings. Offers impressive performance and build quality — features you would expect from a high-end Canon lens.
pros: A versatile lens in the L series family by the brand that offers excellent wide angle shots
Owners rave about the sharp, vibrant photos it produces
Optical Image Stabilizer helps it perform above expectation in low-light settings
cons: Barrel distortion in some settings is possible, which is typical of wide-angle lenses
Pricey, but inline with its quality

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and sharp. I bought this lens to do landscapes, real estate and portraits. I couldn't be happier. It is sharp from corner to corner, fast to auto focus, and I love the image stabilization. I don't ever do video, but I put it on my 5D Mark IV and did a little video for a music video behind the scenes shoot, and it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Clark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the sharpest lens Canon has ever produced! Except for the prime lens. It surpasses the 16-35 F2.8 II without a doubt. I'm so glad I purchased this lens instead of the F2.8 II. It's now my favorite walk-around lens.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest lens I have owned. Too sharp to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Sharpest lens I have owned. Too sharp to use in portrait, which makes all the skin flaws to show up. I just it in landscape only. It's even sharper than my 24-70 f2.8 ii. Now my 24-70 is primarily my portrait lens now. In terms of sharpness, out of all the lens I have, 16-35 >sigma 35mm f1.4 >24-70 f2.8 ii>135 f2>70-300 f4-5.6L. I have owned 50 f1.8 and 85 f1.8, in terms of sharpness goes, they are eating dust of 16-35. Not to mention the IS. The camera used with these lens: Canon 6D and Sony A7R2.
customer_reviews.author: L. H

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens! I'm just starting out in photography, as a hobby, and this is my first L lens. - It's sharp. - Focusing is fast. - IS allows for one second shots by hand. - The aperture and focus rings are smooth. - Almost functions as a macro lens. - Reasonably priced. - Can get decent "bokeh" at f4 and 35mm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, very sharp lens.  Quality~
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens primarily for storm/ lightning and landscape. I don't think a wide angle lens can get much better than this. So sharp and crystal clear. The positive reviews on this are many and I surely agree! So instead of repeating, I will attach some of the images from it over the last two years. All were from this lens attached to either a 5dMKII or 5dsr. If you are thinking about this one, you really cannot go wrong. Get it! Take care~
customer_reviews.author: porknbeans

customer_reviews.title: Great for interiors.
customer_reviews.text: I shoot real estate and this is my go to lens for it. Amazing lens that always produces great images. All images always seem sharp even when blown up. The f4 is not a problem for me because I can usually use higher shutter speeds to compensate. Another great thing is that there is not a great deal of spherical issues, of course on the edges you will see some warping but it is easily corrected in photoshop or just not sitting at 16mm. If you are shooting interiors, I recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable Lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for landscapes, and found myself using it for everything. Great all around lens to have around when you are packing light. Use it in Lonyearbyen, Norway near the North Pole and it took spectacular shots of glaciers and up close wildlife. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mooks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Real Estate Photography
customer_reviews.text: I was using a 17-40mm prior to this purchase. Realtors wanted a little more "depth" so I settled for the 16-35mm. 16mm paired with a full frame body is tack sharp. Fantastic lens.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made lens. The F/4 is a good value since I use this for landscapes and real estate photography and rarely at shoot at F/4. The lens is tack sharp, produce beautiful colors, and is very well made. Very little distortion if you use the lens properly. It is fantastic piece of photography gear. I Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with My Photos
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur photographer so I don't know how to comment on the technical value of the lens - but I do know that it helps me to shoot nice photos. I was afraid to spend the money but...so far I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile; haven't found a use for the f/2.8 variant
customer_reviews.text: Was going back and forth between this one and the f/2.8 variant. I haven't found a need for the f/2.8 yet and I shoot often with this lens. Gets extremely wide on a FF camera. Highly suggested for group shots.
customer_reviews.author: MBLAQ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have just started to upgrade my lenses to the L series and eventually hope to upgrade to a 5DMarkIII body. For now I am using this lens on a T2i and I got to say I love it. It is smooth and well built with a noticeable difference in quality and outcome. I look forward to my next L series lens. I would recommend this lens to anyone that wants to get serious about taking good pictures. I am not a professional, but consider myself to be a serious amateur and photo enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best Ultra-Wide Angle Lens Out There!!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is "consistently" rated as "excellent" by almost every reviewer out there! Not needing the f/2.8 version, I went with the f/4 model because I mainly shoot landscapes. Wow!! This lens is sharp corner to corner!! Clear, crisp and sharp as s tack! And the IS (Image Stablization) is heavenly! If shooting handheld, I can shoot as low as 1/15 on many shots! Get a tripod and the Lee Big Stopper............ and start looking like a professional!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Holland

customer_reviews.title: The lens is amazing. If you have been reading the reviews between ...
customer_reviews.text: The lens is amazing. If you have been reading the reviews between this 16-35 f4,16-35 f2.8 and the 17-40, you'll know it's rated the best. I upgraded from the 10-22mm using a crop camera. Comparing the two, this 16-35 solves a lot of the issues over the 10-22 - Chromatic aberration - Stretching - Blurred corners Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. I was debating whether or not I wanted this one or the F/2.8 version. But seeing how sharp this lens is, I never once miss the single stop of aperture. The edge to edge sharpness over the whole frame, even at F/4, is impressive. There is very little chromatic aberration. The image stabilizer seems unnecessary for such a short focal length lens but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely lens!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens! I purchased this to add an ultra-wide lens to my collection, and I'm glad I did. This lens produces amazing tack-sharp images, has great image stabilization, and fast focus. After a lot of research, I decided the IS would be more useful than a 2.8 aperture, and I feel I made the right choice. Because I shoot mostly landscape images with the lens, I typically won't need the wide aperture. It also takes standard 77mm filters while some of the other ultra-wide lenses cannot take screw on filters. It isn't small, nor is it light, however, it's great for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, it's a great improvement over the 17-40 I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany GTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if your photography needs include something less than 28mm
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality but that's expected with a L Series lens. Use with a Canon D6. One should read up and learn what type of photography this is best for before one buys it. It's a bit of a luxury item. The Canon EF 24-105 (the new version) handles most photo needs as a f4/L. This lens is really for reaching deeper than 28mm. If you have that need absolutely get this lens!
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great for real estate, architecture, interiors
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for shooting architecture, interiors, real estate on the recommendation of a ton of photogs in my field. Great lens for these purposes! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: mayflyaway

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I love my lens, and I love it on my new full frame camera. Difference between my 17-40 f4L on Canon 50D to this lens on the 6D is amazing. Lens itself seems slightly sharper than my 17-40, but I am not a pixel peeper. There are plenty of other sites with reviews that show superior sharpness at the edges. I like having IS for it as I do a lot of hand held shots. I wish it was cheaper, but it seems the be well worth the money so far.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens. Like it better than my previous f ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. Like it better than my previous f 2.8 which was heavier, not sharper. Perfect for the range it covers. Best in class.
customer_reviews.author: veh

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!  Love the Wide Angle and Edge to Edge Sharpness!
customer_reviews.text: Superior lens! I used it on a recent visit to Yosemite and the Sequoia's. Could not have gotten the pictures of the huge trees without this lens. Sharp edge to edge, good color rendition, and fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mhammer491

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding lens.
customer_reviews.text: It's sharp, yes, but this lens' ability to capture light and render color is truly exceptional. The IS works the best of all my Canon L lenses. I've had it a month and look for excuses to use it. The 6D and 16-35 combo produce photos that are tonally impressive, really sharp, and (if I get it right) very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, LOVE my new lens!!! I researched for the longest time before deciding which lens I wanted to purchase for my scenic and architectural photos. I'm so glad that I decided on this one! Picture are tack sharp. Lightweight enough that it was no problem carrying it out on a hike. Now I just need to save up for that full-frame camera!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K Guzik

customer_reviews.title: Better price point
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding between the EF 16-35mm f/4L IS and EF 16-35mm f/2.8, and went with this one. Better price point, IS is a plus, and the lower stop really wasn't needed for everyday wide-angles (I think I'll get a prime for low-light and night sky photography, which seems to be the way to go). Also lighter than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Good for landscape
customer_reviews.text: Using for landscape on my 6d. Love it - really wide. Perspective is significantly changed on architecture photos. I was not able to auto adjust it on my camera. Most probably missing some software update.
customer_reviews.author: Oleksiy Popov

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a well rounded lens line-up!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted in a wide angle lens. The positive reviews that go into detail are accurate. This is now one of my top two go to lens for all of my types of photography. I'm very satisfied and glad I purchased this lens. I'm nearing retirement and want a complete assembly of lens to cover all areas of possible interest and this lens filled a big hole in my line-up. Once again if you are looking for a wide angle lens that performs very well without breaking the bank, this is IT! ( I use a Canon 5D Mk III & 7D Mk II as my tools of choice. )
customer_reviews.author: Ralph K

customer_reviews.title: Great Landscape Lens
customer_reviews.text: It does seem sharper than the 17-40mm f/4L, especially in the corners. And the 17-40 was pretty good. I bought this lens to go with my new 5DS R, so I traded in the 17-40 for this. So far, I'm delighted. Image Stabilization is never a bad thing to have available.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' the 16-35
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking forward to using one of these for a very long time after deciding to make the upgrade to full frame. I didn't think it was possible to love a lens more than my old Canon 10-22 but this 16-35 is fantastic. Sharp all the way to the corners. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: dave b

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Wide
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the Canon C100 Mark ii. Super stable, super wide, and super sharp lens.
customer_reviews.author: Money

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, really fun to use, A+
customer_reviews.text: For sharpness, this lens puts just about all of my other lenses to shame. Really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Lens. Love the wide angle and the pictures you can create with this lens
customer_reviews.author: Paigeb81

customer_reviews.title: Excellent IQ
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one who reviews, but this lenses IQ wowed me even after all the great reviews. I knew this lens was going to be great but I didn’t know it was this good. I shoot a lot of landscapes and I always love to do night photography when I get the chance. This lens has fast focusing and is super sharp. I can’t describe weight because I’m used to handholding a 5d4 with a 70-200 2.8L so every other lens to me is light. When I get some day shots I will update this review
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens Overall
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with the purchase. This is a great lens that is tack sharp and one of my favorites in my bag. The only issue I have had with it is barrel fogging when on the beach in high humidity and wind. It goes away after it adjust to the climate but I have missed shots waiting on it to clear which is frustrating. I don't seem to recall having this issue with other Canon L series glass. Regardless, I have captured some excellent images with it that are some of my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: What a good lens looks like
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens for architectural / interior photograph. One of the benefits I was not expecting is the reduces blow out from over exposed windows. It makes my life so much easier in post-production.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Cordingley

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and exceeds my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens for Car shows, Real Estate photography, and landscapes and It is amazing. I bought it because it has Image Stabilization and even though it was f4. The f2.8 II was known to not be very sharp around the edges. There is a new 16-35mm f2.8 III that is coming out but for what I do. I don't need the f2.8. I am shooting at f6 to f11 to get everything in focus and with Image stabilization I can push the shutter a bit to get that clear image.
customer_reviews.author: Axela

customer_reviews.title: Best $1200 Ultrawide Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sharpness (maybe better than the 16-35 F2.8 L II). Small and lightweight for its purpose and it uses 77mm filters. Not to mention very effective image stabilization. If you don't need F2.8 (and with IS you might not) save half the cost, and 1/2 the weight and go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Liberman

customer_reviews.title: exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens right out of the box I was impressed, took it out for a test run and its so light and pretty easy to handle, very happy with the few pictures I took, very sharp where I needed it to be. Love the zoom. Bought this to do family and large group shots has a nice wide angle that will be ideal for the type of pictures I want to capture.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Williams

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got the f/4 IS over the f/2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for realty work and other landscapes. Glad I got the f/4 IS over the f/2.8 without IS... I don't see a need for f/2.8 with such a wide lines, and the IS will help with any video projects. I have even used the lens for indoor basketball events at school as well; the results are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: PaulC

customer_reviews.title: GREAT "L" Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this lens! The Cannon L series always delivers and never disappoints! A GREAT lens for my collection!
customer_reviews.author: CA Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens has opened up a whole new world for me. I was lacking a great landscape lens and this is it! Tack sharp, fast and love the sunburst I can get with this thing. I know it isn't a macro, but boy oh boy can I get close to flowers and even a bumble bee or two. I can't say enough about this lens. It was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: michelle saylor

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses. The f/4 speed isn't a problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses. The f/4 speed isn't a problem with today's usable high ISOs, It's not too large or heavy for what it is. It's just a really fine lens.
customer_reviews.author: RDKirk

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Stabilizer can help with 1/15 shutter settings - final picture is very crisp. Use with Canon 6D.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. Quiet, fast auto-focusing. Balances well on my 7D w/grip. Takes wonderful photos.
customer_reviews.author: JDH

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful piece of glass, very sharp and sturdy I don't complain about the plastic construction it feels strong enough, this is a must in every photographers bag
customer_reviews.author: Juancho

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Sharp and super wide.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp lens, extremely wide. The image stabilization is very good. I use the lens for real estate photography and shooting video on a Glidecam. The IS on the Glidecam makes it extra smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Williams

customer_reviews.title: One of the best lenses I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple lenses, most of them L, and this one is by far the best one in terms of sharpness. It's also very small and light, considering it's an L lens, and since I bought it, it hasn't left my camera. If what you want is a wide lens for landscape photography, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: SAI

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens. Im so happy to add this lens ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. Im so happy to add this lens to my gear. Sharp corner to corner and very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Horacio Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens. \o/
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome lens for landscape in a full frame body. I have an 24-105mm IS USM and I consider a very good sharp lens. This 16-35mm f/4 exceed my expectation cause I consider sharper than the 24-105 lens. I use it on a Canon 6D and on a T4i. In crop sensor, it's not so sharp as in the FF. To crop sensor, go with Canon 10-18mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, very sharp, easily my favorite wide angle Canon zoom. Fantastic on 5dIII and also great on a 7d.
customer_reviews.author: V. Villevieille

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens, IS and very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this lens. I use it with a Speedbooster, so it's effectively a 2.8 ultrawide with IS. The build is solid, as I'd expect from an L series lens, and the sharpness is really impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Subscribe to my channel to see it used all the time (TRENCHLAND)
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love this lense
customer_reviews.text: I brought this lense with me on my Europe trip. Very happy with the purchase, images are crystal clear and lens is not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ming Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this lens from the day I bought it. Its so tack sharp on the edges too , even at f4, sun stars are crisp. Must have for a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Chauhan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for in perfect condition. 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Evana

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the most sharp wide angle lens I have ever had my hands on. Its sharpness, not only in the centre but also from corner to corner is a proof of its brilliant optical quality. I would highly recommend this lens for anyone looking for a professional level wide angle lens with exceptional image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens!! My photos are finally sharp and clear. I didn't think a lens made such a big difference in the quality of my pictures but I learned that it does. I would highly recommend this lense.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Yo

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Lens. Very sharp. I do not regret getting this over the non IS f/2.8 model particularly for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but all I can say is that is a great lens to have in the inventory
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I did not invest in this lens a long time ago, but all I can say is that is a great lens to have in the inventory. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Jorge H. Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Favorite Ultra-wide Lens so far. Buy it you will be happy you did!
customer_reviews.author: Neal Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, has IS!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my older 17-40mm f/4 lens. This new lens is so much sharper in the corners, little or no chromatic aberrations to correct in post. Just awesome! Plus has IS!
customer_reviews.author: 1elementin7groups

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My most used lens for travel photography. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, needed a wide angle for my lens collection. Performed beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lens for almost a month now and its hardly left my camera. Was using the 24-105 kit lens which came with my canon 6d, and that was my first l series lens and I thought that lens was pretty good, but this thing takes it to the next level. Couldn't be any happier with the lens!
customer_reviews.author: james flames

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens, a real revolution!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I did my research before purchasing this lens - I was about to purchase the older version but then read the reviews on this one. And the reviews are right!!! The quality of the picture is incredible - sharp right to the edges, and the distortion is truly minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Lens
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding IQ, IS & AF. Canon has been knocking it out of the park with these new L series lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Get this instead of F2.8
customer_reviews.text: Picked this lens after trying the F2.8 version. Like many others, I am glad I returned F2.8 in favor of this lens. No need to give more details since it is very well covered by other reviews. Just a vote of confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Mamad

customer_reviews.title: Breath taking pictures!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the sharpest lens Ive ever used. The pictures are as sharp as can be. I was amazed at the quality of the photo's when I saw them. I can highly recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Wide
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens for a wider angle- super quiet as well
customer_reviews.author: Cardinal Visuals LTD. CO

customer_reviews.title: A Very High-qualityy Lense
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lense. I would recommend it to photographers of any level.
customer_reviews.author: stromr

customer_reviews.title: Extreme  sharp and fantastic clarity !
customer_reviews.text: Extreme sharp and fantastic clarity ! I took 80% of my pictures with it during my 2 weeks trip.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Steady!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and Steady! When I shoot wide, I want everything in focus. With this amazing lens, I can shoot handheld at f/8 @ 1/10 second and get beautiful images. I don't use my f/2.8 lens anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bihn

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens, incredibly sharp. I've had good success using IS to take clean images at as low as 1/10s shutter speeds.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME LENS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new Canon 6D and replaced my old 10-22 with this, amazing difference in quality and I couldn't be happier with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: It is a perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: What a lovely lens. It is a perfect in every!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y. Kim

customer_reviews.title: best lens for the wide angle for the money in ...
customer_reviews.text: best lens for the wide angle for the money in my opinion. you dont need F2.8 for the landscape, and people will hate you if you took portrait with it, especially girls. Group photo is good enough at 35mm end F4 anyway. bring this lens with 50 1.4 and 135F2. you will be golden for travel. good improvement compare to the 17-40F4L. you can find tons of review online. But i would still recommend getting a used 17-40 if you are on budget. I have been using that lens for 7 yrs, have a lot good photos with it.
customer_reviews.author: Siri

customer_reviews.title: great colors and contrast
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, great colors and contrast. There is barrel and pincushion distortion when zooming out and in respectively.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for documentary + landscape
customer_reviews.text: I mostly do documentary photography and I just love this range. I used it when my friend bought it and now I purchased one for myself. Super sharp and IS is a big feature for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Asher Imtiaz

customer_reviews.title: A must-have lens for full-frame landscape photographers
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable sharpness and color saturation. I used to swear by my 17-40 f/4 for landscapes, but now, this 16-35 will never leave my camera! I also compared it to my Sigma 35 mm f/1.4 prime lens (one of the sharpest primes ever tested by DxO), and by my untrained eyes, I can see no difference between the Sigma prime and this lens-- an amazing achievement for a zoom lens!
customer_reviews.author: lb311

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens !! - good quality, size, weight, and price. For me, it's fit much better with APS format, like my 80D. It's the best cost X benefit ! - I researched a lot before to buy it, and I just decided for this model, because of the IS. For me it's the most important because I like to take some videos too. Maybe if the new lens 2.8 III would had IS , probability I've bought it is very high. I hope that Canon put the IS on next lens 2.8 of the 16-35 , maybe 2.8 IV.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Negrisoli

customer_reviews.title: Canon finally makes a great wide angle lens.
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with my new Canon wide-angle zoom lens. More flexible and less vignetting than my Zeiss 18mm f/3.5. Auto focus, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. I do real estate photography and it works great. The image quality is superb. The lens is lighter than I expected. Overall I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Fahnestock

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sharpness throughout the frame. IS is a welcome addition for low light shooting. Tight. firm. easy to handle
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best lens Canon makes I think Superb service from the shop that sent
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: WOW. I cannot believe this wide angle! It's a heavier lens than I thought it would be, but I don't mind because it's such HIGH quality. I don't know how I lived without it before. It captures the whole room in one shot. Amazon got here lickety split, too. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: JBP

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this lens for a gift... the reciepent loved this 16-35mm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens for a gift... the reciepent loved this 16-35mm. It lived up to all the positive reviews that were written about it. It is one of his go-to lenses for wildlife and scenery photography. Spot on sharp and a fantastic wide angle lens.
customer_reviews.author: David Isbell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you don't need the 2.8...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant lens. I went from the 16-35 2.8 II because I wanted better corner sharpness. I use it primarily for real estate shoots and don't need the 2.8 for that. This is sharper across the frame and the IS is a great addition. I'll have this lens for a looong time...
customer_reviews.author: Luke C. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest wide zoom
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say unless you are not already a Canon lens user. This lens is likely the sharpest wide zoom currently, even sharper than the more expensive 16-35L. With IS on this one it is amazing shooting in almost darkness with a 5Dmklll.
customer_reviews.author: richphoto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing super sharp wide angle
customer_reviews.text: Amazing super sharp wide angle. Proud to be a red ring owner.Got this lens from Amazon today and the lens is sharp through out from 16mm - 35mm.I previously owned Canon16-35 ver 2. Took only few days to sell that in a good price and grabbed this. Thanks Canon for producing this gem. IS is an added a value.
customer_reviews.author: Asif Navaz

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is amazing. Love how crisp it is and the wide angle. Would recommend it for anyone. I shoot with a Canon 6D.
customer_reviews.author: MJB_01

customer_reviews.title: this is an awesome lens. i use it all the time for ...
customer_reviews.text: this is an awesome lens. i use it all the time for my film work. even in low light its performance is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just great! Very glad with the performance of the lenese.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo ramírez cruz

customer_reviews.title: sent it back to canon and they said its fine, put it on my new 5dsr and blurry ...
customer_reviews.text: My copy is blurry on the right hand side, sent it back to canon and they said its fine, put it on my new 5dsr and blurry there too.. I will be sending it back to canon again and hopefully they will replace it for me with another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: No sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Images were not as sharp as I expected, so I returned item. Presumably it was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Vasyl A

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like lying a bit
customer_reviews.text: Not what I thought of it, I didn't like lying a bit, because the pictures are not the way you expecting them to be.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulkadir S.

customer_reviews.title: A win-win lens...and half the price of the 16-35 2.8 III
customer_reviews.text: This lens has been quite enjoyable to use. My photos have been tack sharp, even in low light. I see few reasons to go with the 2.8 III unless the extra stop of light is really needed. Otherwise, even wide open, this lens is very sharp AND has IS. A win win.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

product_meta.title: Canon EF 16-35mm f/4L IS USM Lens - 9518B002
product_meta.description:
Style:Lens OnlyDelivering the ultimate combination of wide-angle, low-light performance, L-series optics and compact construction, the Canon EF 16-35mm f/4.0L IS USM Lens is a phenomenal complement to any EOS SLR camera. This L-series ultra wide-angle zoom incorporates an Optical Image Stabilizer, and offers up to four stops of correction for admirable performance even in dim light. It features three aspheric lens elements and two UD lens elements to minimize aberrations throughout the zoom range, plus optimized coatings to help minimize ghosting. A circular 9-blade aperture delivers gorgeous background blur. The EF 16-35mm f/4.0L IS USM features inner focusing and ring USM for accurate, discreet and speedy AF. It also offers full-time manual focus and has a minimum focusing distance of 0.92 ft./0.28m across the entire zoom range. Built to function even in unfavorable weather conditions, the EF 16-35mm f/4.0L IS USM is dust-resistant and water-resistant (when used with an optional Canon PROTECT filter) for professional caliber ultra-wide performance, everywhere.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

EF 16–35MM F/4L IS USM
Delivering the ultimate combination of wide-angle, low-light performance, L-series optics and compact construction, the new Canon EF 16–35mm f/4L IS USM lens is a phenomenal complement to any EOS SLR camera. This L-series ultra wide-angle zoom incorporates an Optical Image Stabilizer, and offers up to four stops of correction for admirable performance even in dim light. It features three aspheric lens elements and two UD lens elements to minimize aberrations throughout the zoom range, plus a fluorine coating that helps to minimize ghosting. A circular 9-blade aperture delivers gorgeous background blur. The EF 16–35mm f/4L IS USM features inner focusing and ring USM for accurate, discreet and speedy AF. It also offers full-time manual focus and has a minimum focusing distance of 0.92 ft./0.28m across the entire zoom range. Built to function even in unfavorable weather conditions, the EF 16–35mm f/4L IS USM is dust-resistant and water-resistant (when used with an optional Canon PROTECT filter) for professional caliber ultra-wide performance, everywhere.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Focal Length & Maximum Aperture: 16–35mm 1:4.0
 * Lens Construction: 16 elements in 12 groups
 * Diagonal Angle of View: 108°10' – 63°
 * Focus Adjustment: Inner focus system 
 * Closest Focusing Distance: 0.92 ft. / 0.28m
 * Filter Size: 77mm diameter 
 * Max Diameter x Length, Weight: 3.3 x 4.4 inches, approx. 21.7 oz. / 82.6 x 112.8mm, approx. 615g

MTF CHARTS
feature_bullets: Full-time manual focus permits critical focusing precision, even in AF mode. Help provide excellent color balance
